title: #1 reason Yasuo is banned
body:
{{champion:157}}  0 / 10 / 3 <----- 15 min mark

7 / 10 / 16 <----- end game mark 

Dude literally farms back into the game people know know this but not just how hard he comes back. You can literally shit stomp this parasite and he STILL makes his way back. Recovery and rubber-banding exp/gold effects this champion too hard. The KDA's shown above are no exaggeration thats literally what happens if you give a competent yas a chance to breath. Toxic design to say the least.

fiora and riven cant make plays off their teammates

Yasuo comes back faster than Riven since he has a larger 2-3 item powerspike, that said Riven comes back harder late game because she is better at 5-6 items than Yasuo. Since games are viewed as short and people care a lot about the early game people only focus on the 2-3 item powerspike. 

That is why. Not saying it is a correct way of thinking but Yasuo largely gets hate because of the midgame endings.
Carries scale. No surprise. Especially melee carries. Yasuo scales earlier than most but not as hard by late game.
I'd feel more threatened by a late game Yasuo than any other Yasuo. He scales just as hard late as any other melee carry.

yasuo is worse than any carry in late game due to crit penality (10% and 25% on Q)

you can check that on his win rate
a late game yi will kill tanks in 4 hits and squishies in 2 hits, yi has more than 6% win rate higher than yasuo in late game
Did you expect people to objectively look at data? This is the Boards. You'd have a better chance of convincing people that Donald Trump isn't rascist

(Sarcasm warning) How dare a late-game, basic attacking, crit-based champion be able to come back if you don't properly close out a game! It's what you see all the time when a pro team loses when they are ahead. They have a gold lead (usually achieved through kills/turrets) but cannot capitalize well enough to end the game, and despite the losing team's kda's being fairly shit, they stall and farm the game until gold/kda doesn't matter anymore. Sorry to be so sarcastic, but this is completely fair. If you cannot close out a game versus a late-game champion, you _will_ pay the price for it. {{champion:41}} {{champion:38}} {{champion:11}} {{champion:8}} {{champion:67}} {{champion:114}} {{champion:75}} all do this in varying degrees or have been notorious for it in the past. This is not a matter of Yasuo being toxic design, this is a problem of being unable to play well enough to close out the game before gold becomes irrelevant. That is something that can happen in every game of League, and can either be avoided with good play or allowed to happen and the game can be lost.

Problem is Yasuo has one of the strongest level 1s and 2s. Vayne is consistently shit throughout the entire lane. Gangplank is super vulnerable to all ins even with orange up. Yi has extremely low pressure early game. Kassadin gets shit on everyone who can basic attack before 6 and Fiora sucks in teamfights.

Yasuo's level 1 is not very strong after the E nerfs a while ago gutting the early damage. He can't simply dash through minions level 1 to hit a ~100 damage magic nuke before basic attacking 3 times. If he takes Q the most he can really hope is to hit a tornado unless his opponent brainlessly lets him hit melee Q's. Level 2 is still fairly strong but Talon's is far more oppressive than Yasuo's will ever be in both top and mid. It's not a problem either because you can simply play slightly differently at level 2 and wait until you're 3 to have all of your own abilities. Yasuo, contrary to popular belief, cannot engage on you at any moment he chooses. If you can play differently for a short time to avoid taking his damage, and yet you choose not to for any reason (lack of paying attention, cockiness, etc), that is on your fault as a player, not the design of the champion.

Hard-scaling passive.

5s CD AoE knockup.

Additional CC on ulti.

One of, if not the, strongest utility spells in the game.

Its like his kit has a bunch of stuff that lets him still be impactful while feeding his ass off.

EDIT: doesn't help that since his kit is so polaried, he can 100% beat a champion he counters even when drasticly behind.
Yea but all of that is avoidable and you can be away from minions since his mobility is conditional if you are next to minions.
So he basically zones you and unables farming because he has a no cd no mana mobility spell? Last time a champíon completly zones you from minions his AP scalings were completly deleted.

As an ADC main, I ban Yasuo because I think Windwall is one of the most broken abilities in the game. Regardless of how fed I am, he can completely zone me out of a fight for 3.75 seconds by just pressing w. There's no counter play to it. If I decide to walk up or around it, it's likely that Yasuo can dash onto me since I'm heading towards the windwall that he just placed down. To be able to block every single projectile for 3.75 seconds is ridiculous.

I've been saying this since forever, yet people keep telling me I'm a garbage player and I could just walk around it, yeah right, because it is that easy to reposition, especially if it is a jungle entrance, should I just flash the regular jungle wall to be able to deal dmg or ban him in champ select? Not sure which is the smarter play.
The exaggeration on this comment about Wind Wall is un-real, You claim it as if it's covering the whole freaking map.

Lets see. Wind wall at max level covers roughly 75% width of a lane and any entrance in the jungle. If used in the jungle, there's no way around it. If used in lane, there are very few angles to go around and generally it'll be too risky which results in waiting it out. Correct me if I'm wrong?

I'm no Yasuo player but how is that any different from any other late game champion?

Why I ban Yasuo. 

E-E-E-E-Q-E-Q-E-Q-W (tornadoes me) Fun shit.
Simple solution. Nerf his crit damage, seriously it's such a big part of his power so if that goes, so does his hyper scaling.

His "main counterplay" sadly isn't executable during laning phase, which is the main reason I ban him.
